title: So... I was just scrolling through the new PBE balance changes...
body:
I was so happy! So many cool changes!

---

* Fate's Call (R) cooldown increased to 120/90/60 seconds from 90/75/60.

---

>Karma

>* Focused Resolve (W) cooldown lowered to 12 at all ranks from 16/15/14/13/12

---

>Draven

   >* League of Draven (Passive) now gets a bonus when killing 6 minions in a row without dropping an axe.

---

> Syndra

Then I got to the bottom...

    Shadow Slash (E) damage increased to 80/130/180/230/280 from 60/90/120/150/180

The Fizz Seastone Trident nerfs are ridiculous. I would like to max Seastone Trident or Urchin Strike before Playful/Trickster, but Riot specifically makes it so that the only ability worth ranks in is Playful/Trickster. The other two skills are absolutely stupid to try and max first if the PBE change goes through.

The ult amplification should be fixed a long time ago but Riot was just too lazy with it.

Edit: I'm actually tired of Riot doing jack shit about Seastone Trident.

Lets say that Riot is trying to kill the tank build by completely demolishing the scaling of Seastone Trident with Attack Speed.

1) Change the mana cost on Seastone Trident to 30/35/40/45/50
2) Make Fizz's Seastone Trident passive damage 10/20/30/40/50 + 0.4\*AP **over 2 seconds**
3) Make Fizz's Seastone Trident active give Fizz's autoattack deal an additional 10/20/30/40/50 damage + 0.4\*AP + 3/4/5/6/7% missing health of his attacking target **over 2 seconds**

There, nerfed the on-hit effect severely by changing it to a DoT while the active damage remains relatively unchanged for AP Fizz who attack about once per second. Tank Fizz also loses his uptime on the missing health damage by moving it from the passive to the active, but the damage on the active is still a DoT, so bruiser Fizz loses the synergy between AS and the active. 

Yes, we can also get rid of the missing health damage completely, but the base damage would need to be buffed to compensate. I think the missing health damage should stay so that the base damage doesn't need to exceed 50 for both parts of Seastone Trident.
TBH, Fizz is nearly in Riven territory, and in serious need of a rework.
